🤔 Asking a follow-up question is a great way to drill down into what your audience is interested in and provide more targeted content.

Both options you've suggested are excellent choices, but I think you might want to consider making them even more specific and actionable. Here's a revised version:

**Option 1:** "More about my research and planning process" → "Get a peek into my research methods, including tools and resources I use to stay informed and organized 📚💻"

**Option 2:** "More about my writing routine and productivity habits" → "Learn how I stay focused and productive, including my favorite writing habits, apps, and time management techniques ⏰💻"

By making these changes, you're providing more concrete examples of what your audience can expect to learn from each option. This will help them make a more informed decision and get more value from your content.

Here's a sample tweet to ask your follow-up question:

"Thanks for voting! 😊 For those who want to see more behind-the-scenes of my writing process, I'd love to know: 🤔

A) Get a peek into my research methods, including tools and resources I use to stay informed and organized 📚💻
B) Learn how I stay focused and productive, including my favorite writing habits, apps, and time management techniques ⏰💻

Vote now and help me create content that's tailored to your interests! 🗳️ #writingcommunity #behindthescenes"

Feel free to modify it to fit your tone and style. I hope this helps you get more clarity on what your audience wants to see, and that you're able to create content that resonates with them! 📊
